New Records: Virat Kohli scored 95 runs, the highest for India in the match.
Mohammed Shami took 5 wickets for 54 runs, a new record for India in ODIs.
India achieved their 5th consecutive win in the World Cup.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 46 off 46 balls, setting the tone for India's chase.
Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul formed a 54-run partnership with Virat Kohli.
Suryakumar Yadav made his ODI World Cup debut and was dismissed in a run-out.
Mohammed Shami's five-wicket haul was a pivotal moment.
Ravindra Jadeja bowled a full 10 overs, contributing to India's victory.
Pre-Game Insights: India had not won against New Zealand in an ICC event since 2003.
Hardik Pandya's injury led to Mohammed Shami being included in the team.
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a significant morale booster for India ahead of the World Cup.
Players expressed pride in the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was slow, affecting stroke play.
Fog interrupted play briefly but play resumed quickly.
Others: Mohammed Shami's inclusion was a strategic move due to Hardik Pandya's injury.
This was Shami's first match of the tournament.
